snippet: The Supreme Court ruling on religion at council meetings is a serious setback for church-state separation.
abstract: Op-Ed article by author Katherine Stewart holds Supreme Court decision affirming town of Greece, NY, the right to open council meetings with prayers is serious setback to church-state separation; holds religious right are seeking arrangement in which church and state are separated formally, but in which Christianity is implicitly acknowledged as approved religion; warns decision has furthered this goal.
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court ruling on religion at council meetings is a serious setback for church-state separation.

headline.main: A Big Win for the Prayer Lobby
headline.print_headline: A Big Win for the Prayer Lobby
